thread.title: Here Are the Official Winners of the Sundance Film Festival Awards

author: V Renée
title: Here Are the Official Winners of the Sundance Film Festival Awards

organizations.name: u.s. dramatic  ingrid goes west / u.s.a.

text:
Here Are the Official Winners of the Sundance Film Festival Awards 'I don't feel at home in this world anymore.' The winners of the Sundance Film Festival Awards have been announced! 
After a whirlwind week of screenings and acquisitions, the winners of the Sundance Film Festival Awards have been announced. Films like Dina and I don't feel at home in this world anymore. took home the coveted Grand Jury Prizes, but there were many, many other awards handed out during the ceremony. 
Here is the full list of winners, including the feature film awards, short film awards, and global filmmaking awards. Feature Film Awards U.S. Grand Jury Prize: Documentary 
Dina / U.S.A. (Directors: Dan Sickles, Antonio Santini) U.S. Grand Jury Prize: Dramatic 
I don't feel at home in this world anymore. / U.S.A. (Director and screenwriter: Macon Blair) 'Dina' World Cinema Grand Jury Prize: Documentary 
Last Men in Aleppo / Denmark, Syria (Director: Feras Fayyad) World Cinema Grand Jury Prize: Dramatic 
The Nile Hilton Incident / Sweden, Germany, Denmark (Director and screenwriter: Tarik Saleh) Audience Award: U.S. Documentary 
Chasing Coral / U.S.A. (Director: Jeff Orlowski) Audience Award: U.S. Dramatic 
Crown Heights / U.S.A. (Director and screenwriter: Matt Ruskin) 'Crown Heights' Audience Award: World Cinema Documentary 
Joshua: Teenager vs. Superpower / U.S.A. (Director: Joe Piscatella) Audience Award: World Cinema Dramatic 
Sueño en otro idioma (I Dream in Another Language) / Mexico, Netherlands (Director: Ernesto Contreras, Screenwriter: Carlos Contreras) Audience Award: NEXT 
Gook / U.S.A. (Director and screenwriter: Justin Chon) Directing Award: U.S. Documentary 
The Force / U.S.A. (Director: Peter Nicks) Directing Award: U.S. Dramatic 
Beach Rats / U.S.A. (Director and screenwriter: Eliza Hittman) Directing Award: World Cinema Documentary 
WINNIE / France (Director: Pascale Lamche) Directing Award: World Cinema Dramatic 
God's Own Country / United Kingdom (Director and screenwriter: Francis Lee) 'Beach Rats' Waldo Salt Screenwriting Award: U.S. Dramatic 
Ingrid Goes West / U.S.A. (Screenwriters: Matt Spicer, David Branson Smith) U.S. Documentary Special Jury Award for Inspirational Filmmaking 
STEP / U.S.A. (Director: Amanda Lipitz) U.S. Documentary Special Jury Award for Storytelling 
Strong Island / U.S.A., Denmark (Director: Yance Ford) U.S. Documentary Special Jury Award for Editing 
Unrest / U.S.A. (Editors: Kim Roberts and Emiliano Battista) 'The Yellow Birds' U.S. Documentary Special Jury Award: The Orwell Award 
ICARUS / U.S.A. (Director: Bryan Fogel) U.S. Dramatic Special Jury Award for Best Cinematography 
The Yellow Birds / U.S.A. (DP: Daniel Landin) U.S. Dramatic Special Jury Award for Breakthrough Performance 
Roxanne Roxanne / U.S.A. (Actor: Chanté Adams) U.S. Dramatic Special Jury Award for Breakthrough Director 
Novitiate / U.S.A. (Director and screenwriter: Maggie Betts) World Cinema Documentary Special Jury Award for Excellence in Cinematography 
Machines / India, Germany, Finland (DP: Rodrigo Trejo Villanueva) 'Roxanne Roxanne' World Cinema Documentary Special Jury Award for Commanding Vision 
Motherland / U.S.A., Philippines (Director: Ramona S. Diaz) World Cinema Documentary Special Jury Award for Masterful Storytelling 
RUMBLE: The Indians Who Rocked The World / Canada (Directors: Catherine Bainbridge, Alfonso Maiorana) World Cinema Dramatic Special Jury Award for Cinematography 
Axolotl Overkill / Germany (DP: Manu Dacosse) World Cinema Dramatic Special Jury Award for Cinematic Vision 
Free and Easy / Hong Kong (Director: Jun Geng, Screenwriters: Jun Geng, Yuhua Feng, Bing Liu) World Cinema Dramatic Special Jury Award for Screenplay 
Pop Aye / Singapore, Thailand (Director and screenwriter: Kirsten Tan) 'Axolotl Overkill' Short Film Grand Jury Prize 
And so we put goldfish in the pool. / Japan (Director and screenwriter: Makoto Nagahisa). Short Film Jury Award: U.S. Fiction 
Lucia, Before and After / U.S.A. (Director and screenwriter: Anu Valia). Short Film Jury Award: International Fiction 
And The Whole Sky Fit In The Dead Cow's Eye / Chile, U.S.A. (Director and screenwriter: Francisca Alegría) Short Film Jury Award: Non-Fiction 
Alone / U.S.A. (Director: Garrett Bradley) Short Film Jury Award: Animation 
Broken – The Women's Prison at Hoheneck / Germany (Directors: Volker Schlecht, Alexander Lahl, Screenwriters: Alexander Lahl, Max Mönch) Short Film Special Jury Award for Cinematography 
Dadyaa — The Woodpeckers of Rotha / Nepal, France (DP: Chintan Rajbhandari) Short Film Special Jury Award for Editing 
Laps / U.S.A. (Editor: Blair McClendon) 'And so we put goldfish in the pool.' Global Filmmaking Awards
